reviewText: Was not as good as it sounded and was an old movie so Motherwell done

I can't really give this a review, as I just didn't find it interesting enough to keep watching after the second murder.  Just seemed to be a lot of pretty faces [in a very 80ish way of being pretty], with so little definition given to the 'calendar girls' I couldn't keep them straight.

The made for TV movie Calendar Girl Murders features a solid cast, and an attractive assortment of young starlets, as a number of fashion models fall prey to an unknown killer. Police detective Dan Stoner (Tom Skerritt, Alien) and his team of detectives investigate publisher Richard Trainer (Robert Culp, I Spy) and his stable of models, looking for a lead. Stoner becomes involved with Cassie Bascomb (Sharon Stone, Basic Instinct,Casino), a former model, who may also be at risk. Unfortunately, beside a couple of early kills, and a number of gratuitous shots of the models posing for photos, working out, and hanging out in a pool, this murder mystery doesn't have much going for it. Detective Stoner and his staff don't seem especially competent, and despite being pursued by Sharon Stone's character, the usually low key Skerritt, doesn't bring a lot of energy to his role. What little action there is, seems forced and routinely executed, even for a TV movie. The cast features some familiar names for 1984, including Barbara Bosson (asin:B00GSTHCHQ Hill Street Blues), Alan Thicke (Growing Pains), Rip Taylor, Barbara Parkins, and Meredith MacRae (Petticoat Junction). Besides soon to be megastar Stone, a youthful Claudia Christian (Babylon 5), and Wendy Kilbourne (Midnight Caller) are among those featured as models. This is a rather routine effort, but if you are a Prime member who can watch this for free, it might be of interest to see Stone, Christian, and Kilbourne, early on in their careers.
IT'S NOT A BRILLIANT FILM, BUT I KNEW THAT AND IT MET MY EXPECTATIONS.
Calendar Girl Murders adds a new twist to serial killing - chronologically by month. Interesting concept and although not a great movie, I found it very intertaining.

While watching THE CALENDAR GIRL MURDERS, I noticed two things. Thing #1- Sharon Stone is hotter than the sunny side of Mercury. Thing #2- This movie is almost as exciting as watching blisters heal. It starts out ok, w/ a couple of murders in the first 20 minutes, but soon grinds to a tedious pace. Tom Skerritt (ALIEN, THE DEAD ZONE) isn't bad as the cop on the case. It's just that once Ms. Stone's character appears, the story dives into soap-opera / romance land. It's all about Sharon Stone's character lusting after a married Skerritt. Now, I wouldn't mind so much if this didn't take up about two thirds of the film! Once it got back to the "action" I didn't care anymore. Blecch!...  P.S.- It was funny to read the DVD box for this movie (The TRINITY video release) and see that it is rated EM (EXTREMELY MATURE). This is amazing since TCGM contains no blood, nudity, or even a hint of adult language!...
The quality of this movie is not what I would expect from a movie made this recent.  Sharon Stone is very good.  It's nice to see her in a role where she does not take her clothes off.

This movie is so bad but that's why I stayed with it.  I didn't know Alan Thicke, Tom Skerritt, Robert Culp, and Sharon Stone could make such a colossal bomb of a movie.  From the lousy acting to the terrible soundtrack to the 80's wardrobe this movie won't disappoint those who want to see a bad movie shimmer in its own crappiness.

Would buy it if it was on DVD.

I too purchased this from the bargain bin (2 DVD for around $5). I would compare the quality to that of an old worn out VHS tape thats been recorded over far too many times. The acting was ok, but the storyline and the video quality make it hard to watch.

1980s movie and it shows. Sharon Stone and co-stars do a fair job. The dvd video is extremely poor on my copy. It looks like a bootleg but it is not. Story line has been done before and since and is very predictable. I sat through it only because I bought it out of a bargain bin and figured since I paid for it, I might as well watch it all.

Save your money and your time. Pass on this one at any price.
Good movie.
Must have been made for TV, poor writing and acting.
Very entertaining.
I couldn't stay awake to finish it.
Pretty cheesy movie.  Ending was predictable.
bad. dated
Bad acting. Poor plot.
Stinks
A confusing plot, and the ending makes no sense at all. Still, I did watch it a second time a few days later to see if it made anymore sense. It didn't.
This is basically your typical 80s made-for-TV movie. The writing is awful; the story is predictable; and the acting is nothing to write home about. I stopped watching about a third of the way in.

This looked like a easy, non-challenging movie to watch on a lazy summer afternoon. I always enjoyed movies with Tom Skerritt.  I tried to watch one day and gave up.  I went back the next day to find out the ending but it did not get any better!  For the second, and last time, I stopped watching!
If you want to kill some time one evening, relive the 1980's fashion, and don't want anything challenging, this is the movie for you.  Not Oscar worthy, but not really awful.

Calendar girls are being murdered, but why and by whom? The why is never satisfactorily explained, but we follow the reluctant homicide detective, Stoner, as he slowly determines the killer's identity. Most viewers will beat him to the solution. There is some suspense, a few twists and a lot of overacting along the way. The plot line is enlivened with action and glitz. This movie provides decent entertainment, but if you want to see first rate police procedurals, try the Inspector Lewis series.
Not my cup of tea!
Typical '80s TV movie.
Not a bad movie if your doing something else while watching it.
The best part of this movie was Tom Skerritt.  Surprise ending unless you are good at figuring things out.
Very enjoyable and surprising end!  Loved it!
Exactly what I expected.  No complaints.
Wonderful to see some old actors I haven't seen for a long time.  I liked the story line.  Also love seeing a story line portraying a good cop, and a likable one at that.
It was entertaining but not a work of art.
It wasn't the movie for me. Others might like it though.

Looks like the pilot for a series. All the cliche's are there, the cop who wants to transfer/retire, the over weight Captain who reels him in with one more case. There is the eager young detective, the still trying to get some respect, female detective. But wait there is more,the beautiful, vulnerable girl who needs protection or is she a suspect? The obvious suspect, the rich guy who is hiding something and of course the mysterious suspect that they can't find. All this combines for a  somewhat predictable outcome. There are some stars from T.V. and movies who hit it bigger after this one. It was watchable and in 20 years I may watch it again.
Only watched a short while before I realized it was not going to get any better.
I did not like this movie.... I did not finish watching it.
just a little too old for me. I like newer movies most of the time. Just thought I'd check it out and found it a bit too predictable.
great movie...enjoyed it...love the old classics...
Kept me interested.
TERRIBLE
Really trite.
great
WATCHED ONLY 5 MINUTES.
Old school TV style drama.  It was fun watching the old actors, but it was like a museum piece.
Ha ha! I stopped watching this drivel in less than ten minutes. Listening to Robert Morse sing was excruciating!! I give half star for no nudity!!
Pretty dated not much plot
Bad filming, no post production and terrible script.  Laughing at the fashions from the late 70's early 80's is the only redeeming quality of this dog.
Fun movie to watch ,seeing all the different actors in it!
Silly movie

Very much an 80s period piece. I actually watched it many years ago for the 'detective' aspect, as played by Skerrit. However, I'm not drawn to the world of glamor of any era so it did not hold my interest.
Not to bad. Enjoyed the mystery plot of the movie. A very young Sharon Stone..I would recommend this movie.
Well if you have nothing to do, watch this!

what ireally like is Sharon Stone, i consider her such an underrated actress. i am sorry to see her get some of the roles she did get, but she is, to me, a very good actress, and i think very underrated. i will watch anything she does even if it does smell rather bad as movies go. she is a pleasure to watch.
early tom skerritt adventure... bob culp baddie... good plot but typical of that era...
Old movie and pretty "cheesy" at that.  Definitely in the B movie category. Might have been entertaining in 7th or 8th but definitely past it's prime.
nostalgic
I like tom skerritt but the movie was good it held my attention I like older genre movies
An older movie but, good plot.  Good actors/actresses.  Glad I watched it.
Terribly boring!

this movie was almost an embarrassment to watch. The acting was hokey and the story was nonexistent. I watched it only because Robert Culp was in it. However, his acting (if you call it that) could have been done better by a first year acting student.
Filled with suspense ,twists and turns. A good 'who done it'.
